newsitem.title: UK: Eidos jumps on Playstation sales hopes.
newsitem.headline: Eidos jumps on Playstation sales hopes.

text.p: Shares in Eidos Plc leapt higher on Wednesday after a Financial Times report of booming sales of Sony Corp's Playstation, for which the UK company developed top-selling game Tomb Raider.
Eidos shares were up 47-1/2p at 725 by 1012 GMT in volume of 194,000 shares.
Yesterday Sony Computer Entertainment America said combined North American sales of hardware and software for its Playstation had topped $1 billion this year.
It said more than two million Playstation units had been sold by December 1, and an additional one million were expected to be sold during the holiday season.
The FT said Sony Computer Entertainment said earlier this month it had sold more than 10 million units worldwide so far in 1997.

A spokesman for Eidos said the stock had also been buoyed recently by a successful response to the company's issue of American depositary shares, designed to raise 3 million stg to fund product development and acquisitions. Earlier this year analysts at ABN AMRO Hoare Govett said the stock should be worth 12.00 stg, on the basis of explosive growth in computer games together with the potential of its software product which allows video to be sent along telephone lines.
